# Ahwar of Southern Iraq

| Year          = 2016
| Area          =
| Buffer_zone   =
| locmapin      = Iraq
}}
The Ahwar of Southern Iraq: Refuge of Biodiversity and the Relict Landscape of the Mesopotamian Cities is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Southern Iraq.
The Ahwar currently consists of seven sites, including three cities of Sumerian origin and four wetland areas of the Mesopotamian Marshes:
# Huwaizah Marshes
# Central Marshes
# East Hammar Marshes
# West Hammar Marshes
# Uruk Archaeological City
# Ur Archaeological City
# Tell Eridu Archaeological Site
